meanings.definition: A person who coddles or treats someone with excessive care or kindness.
meanings.sent1: The coddlers at the nursing home always made sure the residents were comfortable.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the neighborhood coddler, always looking out for others.
meanings.sent3: The group of coddlers decided to throw a surprise party for their friend.
meanings.sent4: He was a true coddler, wrapping his friends in warmth and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The image of the coddler holding the baby bird gently in his hands was heartwarming.

meanings.definition: A container used for cooking eggs gently in water.
meanings.sent1: She placed the eggs in the coddlers and set them to boil.
meanings.sent2: The chef used the coddlers to make perfectly poached eggs for brunch.
meanings.sent3: The coddlers were bubbling happily on the stove, cooking the eggs to perfection.
meanings.sent4: The steam rose from the coddlers, enveloping the kitchen in a warm aroma.
meanings.sent5: The shiny silver coddlers gleamed under the kitchen lights, ready for breakfast.

meanings.definition: To treat someone with excessive care or kindness.
meanings.sent1: She would often coddle her pet cat, giving it treats and cuddles.
meanings.sent2: Parents sometimes coddle their children to protect them from harm.
meanings.sent3: He decided to coddle his plants by singing to them every morning.
meanings.sent4: The coach refused to coddle the players, pushing them to do their best.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would coddle her students, always ready to offer help and support.
